document.masterDocTitle: New records of water mites of the genus Atractides Koch, 1837 (Acari: Hydrachnidia, Hygrobatidae) from Thailand, Malaysia and Sulawesi (Indonesia), with the description of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New records of water mites of the genus Atractides Koch, 1837 (Acari: Hydrachnidia, Hygrobatidae) from Thailand, Malaysia and Sulawesi (Indonesia), with the description of four new species

30 .xi.2007

48.106 N
99 °

, no GPS-coordinates, leg. Smit, 2 / 5 /0 ( 1 / 1 /0 mounted); stream downstream of Siriphum Waterfall, Doi Inthanon NP, alt. 1300 m ,

, alt. 1011 m , leg. Smit, 1 / 4 /0 ( 1 / 1 /0 mounted); Jerian stream, Fraser’s Hill,
16 .ii.2009

101 °
42.935 E
, alt. 1011m , leg. Smit, 3 /0/0 ( 1 /0/0 mounted).

Morphology. General features. Integument dorsally striated. Muscle attachment plates unsclerotized. Genital field: Ac in triangular arrangement; excretory pore smooth; Vgl- 1 separated from Vgl- 2 . Palp: weak sexual dimorphism; P- 2 ventral margin straight, sword seta of P- 4 between ventral hair insertions. I-Leg: I- Leg- 5 thickened, setae S- 1 and - 2 distanced, S- 1 slender, slightly curved, S- 2 enlarged, both with blunt tips; I- Leg- 6 curved, thickened basally.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9A–D .
Atractides schwoerbeli
Lundblad
, 1969
, male, stream W of Bankrang Camp, Thailand: A = coxal and genital field; B = genital field; C = palp, medial view; D = I-Leg-5 and - 6. Scale bar = 100 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph: In addition we give measurements of the females from Jerian stream, Malaysia which are suspected to belong to the same species (general differences see below in the “remarks”-section).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 10A–B .
Atractides schwoerbeli
Lundblad
, 1969
, female, stream downstream of Huoay Meng, Thailand: A = coxal and genital field; B = palp, lateral view. Scale bars = 100 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
I-Leg (
Fig. 13 B
): I-Leg- 5 dL 183 , vL 108 , dL/vL 1.69 , HB 58 , dL/HB 3.16 , S- 1 L 129 , L/
W 12.2
, S- 2 L 99 , L/
W 5.7
, distance of sword setae at I-Leg- 5 35 , L S- 1 / 2 1.3 ; I-Leg- 6 L 163 , HB 18 , L/HB 9.3 ; L I-Leg- 5 / 6 1.12 .

Remarks . The specimens from Thailand agree with
Atractides schwoerbeli
, known from Burma (
Lundblad 1969
) due to the presence of striated dorsal integument, a weak sexual dimorphism of P- 2 , a narrow S- 1 and - 2 interspace, thickened I-Leg- 6 and a long and slender I-Leg- 6 . The males have a Vgl- 3 fused to Cx- 4 , but this character is known to be variable (see
Figs. 9 A
,
12 A
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 11A–B .
Atractides schwoerbeli Lundblad, 1969
, female (A-specimen from stream downstream of Huoay Meng, Thailand; B-juvenile specimen from stream W of Bankrang Camp, Thailand): A-B = I-Leg-5 and - 6. Scale bar = 100 μm.

FIGURE 12A–D .
Atractides schwoerbeli
Lundblad
, 1969
, male, Jerian stream, Malaysia: A = coxal and genital field; B = genital field; C = palp, medial view; D = I-Leg-5 and - 6. Scale bar = 100 μm.

FIGURE 13A–C .
Atractides schwoerbeli
Lundblad
, 1969
, female, Jerian stream, Malaysia: A = coxal and genital field; B = I-Leg-5 and – 6; C = palp, medial view. Scale bar = 100 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The specimens from Jerian stream, Malaysia , differ from specimens of
A. schwoerbeli
from Burma (see
Lundblad 1969
) and our material from Thailand in a slightly more distant S- 1 and S- 2 on I-Leg- 5 and more slender I-Leg- 6 . Further studies on the variability of populations of
A. schwoerbeli
are necessary before we can assess the taxonomic status of these specimens.
